Title: Philip Asiodu: Blast from the years locusts ate our civil service (3)
Summary: Philip Asiodu's confidence, courage and capacity to speak truth to power would be an albatross to the deployment of his talents . What played out as early retirement in 1975 was not the only time that his confidence and courage would be a problem .

Title: How Does the Average Person Make a Living in Nigeria?
Summary: This piece addresses a question I encounter constantly: how do ordinary Nigerians actually earn their living in Nigeria? It represents months of careful research and years of covering Nigeria’s employment landscape .

Title: Oborevwori’s infrastructure momentum and new era of fiscal discipline in Delta
Summary: Governor Sheriff Oborevwori offered a portrait of a state undergoing one of its boldest phases of development in years . Delta is undergoing a new era of fiscal discipline in Delta .

Title: 13 days to expiration, Tinubu seeks to cut 2025 budget  by over N6tr, presents N58.18tr 2026 budget estimates
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has moved to scale down the nation’s 2025 budget by over N6 trillion . With just 13 days left in the 2025 fiscal year, the president has requested to extend the budget . This is as the president formally requested the National Assembly's approval .

Title: Why new refineries alone won’t end Africa’s fuel importation ‘slavery’
Summary: As refineries shut down across Europe, Africa should be seizing its moment . Africa is stuck in a crippling loop, building refineries while still importing crude and depending on foreign fuel . It is a self-inflicted vulnerability with a bleak outlook for the continent .

Title: Joshua knocks out Paul to win Netflix boxing bout
Summary: Joshua knocks out Paul to win Netflix boxing bout . "I just got tired to be honest. I think with better cardio I could have kept it up and kept on fighting," says Joshua .

Title: Peter Obi and the elephant he must shoot, by Emmanuel Aziken
Summary: It may appear superfluous to once again warn of the existential threat confronting Nigeria’s continued existence as a multiparty democracy, especially given the manner in which the All Progressives Congress (APC) has continued to ride roughshod across the political landscape . Yet what remains disturbingly underappreciated is not the threat itself

Title: Waiting for the back door, by Stephanie Shaakaa
Summary: We can enter through the back door, but we should not pretend we arrived, because no country stumbles into greatness, says Shaakaa .

Title: After 65 years of stability, Awujale throne triggers unprecedented succession storm
Summary: Oba Sikiru Kayode Adetona, the revered Awujale of Ijebuland, died five months ago . The revered Oba ruled for 65 years . *60 princes jostle for the throne . The ancient city remains in anxious anticipation of his successor .

Title: After leaving office, Buhari family’s calendar was filled with funerals — Aisha
Summary: The final days of President Muhammadu Buhari were traumatic for the family due to the former president's serious health challenges . The former president was in his eighties when he completed his two terms . The family's calendar was filled with funerals .

Title: Oyo approves conversion of 654 officers across cadres
Summary: Oyo State Governor, Seyi Makinde, has approved conversion of 654 officers across various cadres in Ministries, Departments, and Agencies of the state . The beneficiaries are officers in sub-officer cadres, ranging from junior to senior levels . Chairman, Civil Service Commission, Kamoru Aderibig

Title: JUST IN: Anthony Joshua floors Jake Paul in sixth-round knockout
Summary: Former heavyweight champion, Anthony Joshua, delivered a dominant performance on Saturday morning, stopping YouTuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul with a sixth-round knockout in their heavyweight bout in Miami . The British boxer dropped Paul twice during a chaotic fifth round, setting the stage for the finish . Joshua sealed the victory in the sixth round,

Title: Navy trains, graduates 323 personnel in Kaduna
Summary: The Nigerian Navy School of Armament Technology, Kachia, Kaduna State, on Friday graduated 323 personnel from the Quarter Armourer and Fire Control I–III courses . Governor Uba Sani said the event marked a historic milestone in celebrating discipline, commitment and professional excellence of the graduands .

Title: Troops intercept two vans supplying logistics to ISWAP in Borno
Summary: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai have intercepted two pick-up vans suspected of conveying logistics supplies to Islamic State West Africa Province terrorists in Borno State . The operation was conducted following credible human intelligence, which alerted the operation’s headquarters to the movement of items from Dapchi in Yobe State towards Magumeri general

Title: Comply with S’Court order on LG autonomy, Tinubu tells govs
Summary: President Bola Tinubu gave the warning on Friday during the 15th National Executive Committee meeting of the All Progressives Congress at the State House Conference Centre, Abuja . He warned that failure by governors to honour the verdict may compel him to issue an Executive Order to ensure direct allocations from the Federation Account to local councils .
